notes.text:
A vulnerability in the web framework of multiple Cisco
TelePresence products  could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to inject arbitrary commands that are executed with the privileges of
the root user.



The vulnerability is due to insufficient input
validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by
authenticating to the device and submitting crafted input to the
affected parameter in a web page. Administrative privileges are required
in order to access the affected parameter. A successful exploit could allow an
attacker
to execute system commands with the privileges of the root user.



Cisco has released software updates that address this vulnerability. Workarounds that mitigate this vulnerability are not available.
This advisory is available at the following link:

http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150513-tp["http://tools.cisco.com/security/center/content/CiscoSecurityAdvisory/cisco-sa-20150513-tp"]
notes.title: Summary

notes.text:
The following products are affected when they are running a vulnerable software version:


    Cisco TelePresence Advanced Media Gateway Series
    Cisco TelePresence IP Gateway Series
    Cisco TelePresence IP VCR Series
    Cisco TelePresence ISDN Gateway 
    Cisco TelePresence MCU 4200 Series 
    Cisco TelePresence MCU 4500 Series
    Cisco TelePresence MCU 5300 Series
    Cisco TelePresence MCU MSE 8420 
    Cisco TelePresence MCU MSE 8510
    Cisco TelePresence Serial Gateway Series
    Cisco TelePresence Server 7010
    Cisco TelePresence Server MSE 8710
    Cisco TelePresence Server on Multiparty Media 310
    Cisco TelePresence Server on Multiparty Media 320
    Cisco TelePresence Server on Virtual Machine
notes.title: Vulnerable Products

notes.text: No other Cisco products are currently known to be affected by this vulnerability.
notes.title: Products Confirmed Not Vulnerable

notes.text:
A vulnerability in the web framework of multiple Cisco
TelePresence products  could allow an authenticated, remote attacker to
inject arbitrary commands that are executed with the privileges of
the root user.



The vulnerability is due to insufficient input
validation. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by
authenticating to the device and submitting crafted input to the
affected parameter in a web page. Administrative privileges are required
in order to access the affected parameter. A successful exploit could allow an
attacker
to execute system commands with the privileges of the root user.



The following table includes the Cisco bug ID used to identify this vulnerability for each affected product:




    
        
             Product Name

            
             Cisco bug ID

            
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence Advanced Media Gateway Series Software

            
             CSCur15855["https://bst.cloudapps.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/CSCur15855"] (registered["http://tools.cisco.com/RPF/register/register.do"] customers only) 

            
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence IP Gateway Series Software

            
             CSCur15842["https://bst.cloudapps.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/CSCur15842"] (registered["http://tools.cisco.com/RPF/register/register.do"] customers only)
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence IP VCR Series Software

            
             CSCul55968["https://bst.cloudapps.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/CSCul55968"] (registered["http://tools.cisco.com/RPF/register/register.do"] customers only)
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence ISDN Gateway Software

            
             CSCur15832["https://bst.cloudapps.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/CSCur15832"] (registered["http://tools.cisco.com/RPF/register/register.do"] customers only)
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence MCU Software

            
             CSCur15825["https://bst.cloudapps.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/CSCur15825"] (registered["http://tools.cisco.com/RPF/register/register.do"] customers only)
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence MCU MSE Software

            
             CSCur15807["https://bst.cloudapps.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/CSCur15807"] (registered["http://tools.cisco.com/RPF/register/register.do"] customers only)
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence Serial Gateway Series Software

            
             CSCur15850["https://bst.cloudapps.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/CSCur15850"] (registered["http://tools.cisco.com/RPF/register/register.do"] customers only)
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence Server Software (Hardware and for Virtual Machine)

            
             CSCur15803["https://bst.cloudapps.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/CSCur15803"] (registered["http://tools.cisco.com/RPF/register/register.do"] customers only) and CSCur08993["https://bst.cloudapps.cisco.com/bugsearch/bug/CSCur08993"] (registered["http://tools.cisco.com/RPF/register/register.do"] customers only)
        
    





This vulnerability has been assigned the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) Identifier CVE-2015-0713.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: There is no workaround for this vulnerability.
notes.title: Workarounds

notes.text:
When considering software upgrades, customers are advised to consult the Cisco Security Advisories, Responses, and Alerts archive at http://www.cisco.com/go/psirt["http://www.cisco.com/go/psirt"] and review subsequent advisories to determine exposure and a complete upgrade solution. 

In all cases, customers should ensure that the devices to be upgraded contain sufficient memory and  confirm that current hardware and software configurations will continue to be supported properly by the new release. If the information is not clear, customers are advised to contact the Cisco Technical Assistance Center (TAC) or their contracted maintenance providers. 

The following table lists the releases that fix this vulnerability for each of the affected products:




    
        
             Product Name

            
             Fixed Releases

            
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence Advanced Media Gateway Series Software

            
             1.1(1.40) and later

            
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence IP Gateway Series Software

            
             No fix is planned. Product is End of Maintenance Support  

            
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence IP VCR Series Software

            
             3.0(1.27) and later

            
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence ISDN Gateway Software

            
             2.2(1.94) and later

            
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence MCU Software

            
             4.4(3.54) and later

             4.5(1.45) and later

            
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence MSE Supervisor Software

            
             2.3(1.38) and later

            
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence Serial Gateway Series Software

            
             1.0(1.42) and later

            
        
        
            Cisco TelePresence Server Software (Hardware and for Virtual Machine)

            
             3.1(1.98) for Hardware release

             4.1(1.79) for Virtual Machine
notes.title: Fixed Software

notes.text: To learn about Cisco security vulnerability disclosure policies and publications, see the Security Vulnerability Policy[http://www.cisco.com/web/about/security/psirt/security_vulnerability_policy.html]. This document also contains instructions for obtaining fixed software and receiving security vulnerability information from Cisco.
notes.title: Vulnerability Policy

notes.text:
The Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory. 

This vulnerability was found during product security reviews.
notes.title: Exploitation and Public Announcements

publisher.issuing_authority:
Cisco product security incident response is the responsibility of the Cisco Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT). The Cisco PSIRT is a dedicated, global team that manages the receipt, investigation, and public reporting of security vulnerability information that is related to Cisco products and networks. The on-call Cisco PSIRT works 24x7 with Cisco customers, independent security researchers, consultants, industry organizations, and other vendors to identify possible security issues with Cisco products and networks.
More information can be found in Cisco Security Vulnerability Policy available at http://www.cisco.com/web/about/security/psirt/security_vulnerability_policy.html
publisher.name: Cisco
